title: Black Bean and Corn Salsa Salad
description: A quick, vibrant salad or dip that's perfect for potlucks or a light lunch.

instructions.text: Combine black beans, corn, red onion, and red bell pepper in a large bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the bean and corn mixture. Stir in chopped cilantro.
Chill for at least 15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld. Serve as a salad or with tortilla chips.

title: Speedy Tuna Melts
description: Classic comfort food: creamy tuna salad on toast topped with melted cheese.

instructions.text: In a bowl, mix tuna, mayonnaise, celery, salt, and pepper.
Toast bread slices lightly.
Spread tuna mixture evenly over two slices of toast.
Top with cheese slices.
Broil or toast in a toaster oven until cheese is melted and bubbly.

title: 20-Minute Lemon Butter Pan-Seared Salmon
description: Flaky salmon cooked quickly in a delicious lemon butter sauce.

instructions.text: Pat salmon fillets dry, season with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Place salmon skin-side down (if using skin) and cook for 4-6 minutes until crispy.
Flip salmon, reduce heat to medium. Add butter to the pan.
Once butter melts, add garlic and cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds).
Stir in lemon juice and parsley. Baste salmon with the sauce. Cook for another 2-4 minutes until salmon is cooked through.

title: Quick Veggie Quesadillas
description: Cheesy quesadillas filled with vegetables, ready in minutes.

instructions.text: Heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.
Place one tortilla in the skillet. Sprinkle half of it with cheese, beans, corn, and bell pepper.
Fold the other half of the tortilla over the filling.
Cook for 2-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and cheese is melted.
Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa or sour cream.

title: Grown-Up Grilled Cheese
description: An elevated grilled cheese sandwich with gourmet cheeses and additions.

ingredients.name: Optional: Fig Jam, Bacon, Caramelized Onions

instructions.text: Butter one side of each bread slice.
Place one slice butter-side down in a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat.
Layer cheeses (and optional additions) on the bread in the skillet.
Top with the second bread slice, butter-side up.
Grill for 4-5 minutes per side, until bread is golden brown and cheese is melted and gooey.
